column5: Got this sent to me...  I'm still shaking my head!!    cheers HD
Cool video.  The sm's aren't so tough when they are dwarfed in size by a random dude snorkeling with them.
Thats AMAZING !!!!...a trained smallmouth bass.  ..now i think i have seen it all    thanks for sharing that clip
Yer such a Smallie Dumb Dawg Fee-dell!!!
A who?!  Heat gettin to you ya down there in the swaller or wuut?    Koon twinkler..  LOL
That was cool.   I like the part with the crawfish  Joey

theres a place called gullovers its a pond with bass in it, its no fishing tho only swimming the bass are so use to people that you can actually touch them and get them to eat out of your hand its pretty awsome.
LOL,  That was pretty amazing!!...  If he could teach it to jump out and land on the plate he'd be loaded...lol lol.   wow!!  Thanks for shar'n  JIm

Thats very cool. As a child I spent my summers on Pigion Lake. That video looks very familiar. When I used to catch crawfish........ironically for fishing, I too would have smallmouth following me around, gobbling up any thing that I missed. We worked together as a team. I lifted the rocks to spook out the craws and the smallies snatched them up quicker than a fat kid on a smartie. lots of fun........pet bass for the summer.
I jus' wanna know when we're gonna see some pics of Miss Tanya "feeding the fish"???
I hear that!!  time for a feedin...
Years ago when scuba diving this was a passtime for me and my buddies. Seems smallies are opportunistic everywhere. No fear. Pickerel and pike were no where to be seen.

Cool video! I used to fish a water filled limestone quarry years ago, the guy that ran it had a a little bait shop tackle store in a garage at the waters edge. He didn`t open till like 7 am and we would be there early to wait for him to watch him feed the fish with the dead minnows out of his minnow tanks.  They knew his footsteps, you could walk by the ledge to the water and not see a fish, but let him walk to the edge and they were right there. Put a minnow on a hook there and all that happened would be bluegills picking the eyes out. Worst place on the quarry to fish.

Them jumping for the worms is spectacular!  I've had a bass friend like that one summer.  A largie and a big rock near Penetang.  Never got to touch him though, we didn't have that bond *cries*  My advice, get in the water with a mask and a snorkel!  Its amazing under there!
